# UIStatusBarManager

**Class**

An object that describes the configuration of the status bar.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIStatusBarManager
```

## Overview

Use a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIStatusBarManager] object to get the current configuration of the status bar for its associated scene. You don’t create [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIStatusBarManager] objects directly. Instead, you retrieve an existing object from the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindowScene/statusBarManager] property of a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindowScene] object.

You don’t use this object to modify the configuration of the status bar. Instead, you set the status bar configuration individually for each of your [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController] objects. For example, to modify the default visibility of the status bar, override the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/prefersStatusBarHidden] property of your view controller.

## Getting the status bar configuration

- **isStatusBarHidden**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the status bar is currently hidden.
- **statusBarStyle**: The current appearance of the status bar.

## Getting the frame rectangle

- **statusBarFrame**: The frame rectangle of the status bar.

## Device environment

- **UIDevice**: A representation of the current device.

## Inherits From

- NSObject
